author: Daniel Kruger
title: Foreign Investors Are Bulking Up on U.S. Treasury Bonds Once Again
text:
A surge in demand for U.S. government debt from foreign investors is providing a bulwark against a further rise in Treasury yields.
Foreign investors in February bought their largest share of Treasury notes and bonds in U.S. government debt auctions since May 2016, according to Treasury Department data. Those purchases continued even while Treasury yields, which rise as bond prices fall, were climbing to multiyear highs. Yields have climbed as the U.S. ramped up bond sales to fund tax cuts and increased government spending,... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
